title: Newtons second law - center of mass acceleration

content.question: A system consists of three discrete masses, and a different rightward force is exerted on each mass. A <math alttext="2 newton" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mtext> N</mtext></math> force is exerted on the <math alttext="2 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mtext> kg</mtext></math> mass, a <math alttext="16 newton" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>16</mn><mtext> N</mtext></math> force is exerted on the <math alttext="4 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mtext> kg</mtext></math> mass, and a <math alttext="42 newton" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>42</mn><mtext> N</mtext></math> force is exerted on the <math alttext="6 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>6</mn><mtext> kg</mtext></math> mass as shown in the figure. What is the magnitude of the acceleration of the center of mass of the system?
